baseline_0: What are your thoughts on the use of formal language in modern communication? Do you think it is still relevant or necessary in today's society?
z_gen_informal_1: Yooo, ngl formal language is kinda crusty 😂 Like, who even talks like that anymore? We're out here vibing with emojis and memes. I mean, unless you're tryna impress someone in a suit or write an essay for school, idk if it's really that deep fr 🤷‍♀️ But hey, what do you think? Would you ever text your crush with "Dear Sir/Madam"? Deadass curious! 💀
baseline_1: Haha, yeah, I totally get what you mean! Formal language can feel pretty outdated in most casual settings. It's like speaking a whole different dialect sometimes. But I guess it still has its place, especially when you're dealing with professional emails or trying to make a good impression in certain situations. It's all about reading the room, right? Have you ever been caught off guard by someone using really formal language out of nowhere?
z_gen_informal_2: OMG, yes! 😂 One time my friend sent me a text starting with "To whom it may concern," and I was like... bro, are you filing a complaint or texting me? 💀 It's all about vibes for real. Like, if you're applying for jobs or chatting up your boss, maybe bust out the fancy words. But in normal convos? Nah fam, keep it chill. What's the most formal thing you've said to someone by accident and cringed later? 🙈 Spill the tea! ☕️
